author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/libsvn_client/commit_util.c
(svn_client__harvest_committables): Fix bug committing a newly added
file by name.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/commit_tests.py
(commit_one_new_file, test_list): New commit case test code by
Marcus Comstedt <marcus@mc.pp.se>, save for an itty bitty fix I made
(to not expect 'gloo' to have properties present)

author: gstein
msg: [ fix by kfogel after investigation on my laptop ]
XEmacs does not handle the NOWARN parameter to find-file-noselect.
[Or anyway, does not handle it the same way FSF Emacs does.  -kff]
Thus, we need to ensure the directory exists before trying to visit
the entries file.
* tools/dev/svn-dev.el (svn-controlled-path-p): check that the
directory exists before trying to examine the entries file.
(): re-enable adding the find-file hook.

author: kfogel
msg: Thanks to Tim Moloney <moloney@mrsl.com> for pointing out that these
docs needed updating:
* subversion/libsvn_repos/hooks.txt: Bring up to date.
* subversion/libsvn_repos/repos.c (create_hooks): Make templates
mention that hook scripts need to be executable by httpd.

author: gstein
msg: Disable the borken behavior when visiting non-SVN areas.
As the comment states, when I tried to visit an APR file (in my case,
it was ~/src/svn/apr/include/apr_file_io.h), I got a prompt about
creating a .svn area. I'm not sure how to fix that, so I'm punting
this whole thingymabob.

author: sussman
msg: Final fixes to issue #581: calculate IS_DIR correctly within
get_baseline_info.  This fixes the 'svn cp -r' bug, which was failing
due to svn_ra__dav_do_check_path's particular use of this routine.
* props.c (svn_ra_dav__get_baseline_info): if IS_DIR needs to be
returned to the caller, then we *must* calculate it after decisively
finding bc_url and bc_relative -- by putting the two pieces together
and doing another PROPFIND for DAV:resourcetype.  [The value of
IS_DIR can no longer be taken directly from the bc_relative
resource, since we might have retrieved a *parent* resource
instead.]
